items.title: Three senior Nationals quit frontbench after defying shadow cabinet on hate speech laws
items.description: Senior Nationals Bridget McKenzie, Ross Cadell and Susan McDonald quit the shadow cabinet, after defying its position on the government's hate speech reforms in a late-night vote on Tuesday.

items.title: Nationals threat of mass resignation from shadow ministry a 'live option', Liberal source says — as it happened
items.description: A Liberal source has told the ABC that multiple Nationals resignations from the shadow ministry is a "live option" after three Nationals quit the shadow cabinet.

items.title: Canadian PM Mark Carney speaks out against Trump at the World Economic Forum
items.description: Canadian PM Mark Carney told the World Economic Forum "middle powers must act together".

items.title: Beijing has a nickname for Trump: The Chinese 'nation-builder'
items.description: Inside China, there's a nickname for Donald Trump that tells you everything you need to know about how the US leader's actions are increasingly seen as a gift to Beijing.

items.title: Mother of teenager found dead on K'gari says life 'will never be the same'
items.description: The body of Canadian Piper James was found on K'gari (Fraser Island) surrounded by a pack of dingoes after she told friends she was going for an early morning swim.

items.title: Australia's NATO envoy is returning home with a warning about North Korea
items.description: Australia's outgoing military envoy to NATO is preparing to return to Canberra after two years in the role, and she is coming home with a warning.

items.title: Man sentenced to life in prison for assassination of Japan's Shinzo Abe
items.description: Tetsuya Yamagami pleaded guilty to fatally shooting Mr Abe as he stood surrounded by security, media and supporters in 2022.

items.title: Prime minister's national security adviser Philippa Brant resigns
items.description: Philippa Brant has resigned just months after the PM's top foreign policy adviser departed to run the Office of National Intelligence.

items.title: Australian shark attack data reveals where bite incidents happen most
items.description: An ABC analysis of the national Shark-Incident Database shows that the average number of verified shark bite incidents recorded annually over a decade has increased every 10 years since the 1950s.

items.title: Midnight Oil's Rob Hirst died of one of Australia's deadliest cancers
items.description: Rob Hirst was first diagnosed with pancreatic cancer in 2023. It is estimated to be the third most common cause of cancer death in Australia, and has among the lowest survival rates.

items.title: Live: Thompson shooting for career-best Aus Open outing as Alcaraz stretched
items.description: Jordan Thompson and Ajla Tomljanovic are trying to turn around a tough day for the local hopes at the Australian Open, while top seeds Aryna Sabalenka and Carlos Alcaraz make it through to the third round. Follow live.

items.title: How Australia will mark the National Day of Mourning for Bondi victims
items.description: Thursday will be a national day of mourning for the victims of the Bondi Beach terror attack. Here's what you need to know.

items.title: Police slap bans on neo-Nazis entering Sydney CBD on Australia Day
items.description: Up to 12 neo-Nazis have been issued public safety orders banning them from entering central Sydney, shutting down plans to attend anti-immigration rallies on Australia Day.

items.title: Have you been gifted an ancestry DNA test? The results could be 'life-altering'
items.description: If you're thinking of taking an ancestry DNA test as "a bit of fun", experts warn there is the risk of uncovering more than you bargained for.

items.title: What we know about UK entry requirements for dual citizens from February 25
items.description: Hundreds of confused UK and Irish dual citizens in Australia have written to the ABC with questions around the new changes for entry requirements into the UK. Here's what we know.

items.title: Man accused of threatening to shoot prime minister granted bail
items.description: A NSW Mid North Coast man is granted bail after he allegedly threatened to shoot the prime minister, in a video uploaded to social media.

items.title: The public pool should be accessible for all — but for many, it isn't
items.description: A new exhibition in Western Sydney interrogates Australia's enduring love affair with the pool.

items.title: 'Off the charts' aurora australis puts on spectacular show across Australia
items.description: A severe geomagnetic storm has hit Earth, providing for a colourful light show in Australia's skies.

items.title: Australia's most expensive capital for fuel dogged by volatile price cycles
items.description: Brisbane's fuel prices are more expensive than any other capital city for the third year in a row, with the RACQ revealing the cheapest suburbs to fill up.

items.title: New Alice Springs mayor will not take part in Australia Day celebrations
items.description: Asta Hill will not take part in celebrations of Australia Day, which she sees as a day causing harm to First Nations peoples — a decision described as "disgraceful" by the local member of the Northern Territory Legislative Assembly.

items.title: Donald Trump, the madman theory, and why even Australia is not safe
items.description: One year into Trump's second term, something has become clear: even those who leave the Oval Office with a deal, beware. It might not be worth the paper it's written on.

items.title: Record for hottest temperature in Australia may tumble in WA this week
items.description: Towns in WA's north-west could be about to experience Australia's hottest day on record, with the weather bureau expecting temperatures of 50 degrees Celsius in some areas.

items.title: How Dame Marie Bashir 'led with humanity' throughout her trailblazing life
items.description: Dame Marie Bashir was the first female and first Lebanese person to become NSW governor, but her accolades span decades further back as a pioneer in mental health and psychiatry.

items.title: NZ Prime Minister Christopher Luxon calls for election on November 7
items.description: NZ's Prime Minister Christopher Luxon has announced the election date for 2026, promising economic prosperity if New Zealanders vote for him again.

items.title: Labor seizes on leaked SA Liberal document as attempt to 'destabilise'
items.description: The leaking of an SA Liberal document two months before the state election has been described by the Labor government as a "calculated and methodical" attempt to "destabilise" new leader Ashton Hurn — but her party says it is "not that stressed" because the policy is old.
